{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3527045,"name":"","username":"robojack","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T15:38:49.694Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to use the SmartDashboard option on the driver station and I’m able to put numbers on the screen but they are too small to be easily read. I’ve seen some posts that say you can do this by making making things editable and clicking on properties. Sadly I can’t seem to be able to do this. These numbers are constantly changing as the robot moves so I need to be able to write numbers on the fly. (We do that now but can’t change the font size.)

We need the info to be much larger to be useful for us.

Is there a way to do this with SmartDashboard or do I need to change to a different one? I’ve tried Default and LabVIEW but I don’t seem to be able to print arbitrary numbers and/or change their size.

Any thoughts, examples, ideas or other happily accepted

Elastic JUST released with this feature, many thanks to the Elastic team for implementing exactly this feature.

GitHub

Release Elastic 2025.1.0 · Gold872/elastic-dashboard

Baby Dashboard I think we can now nickname this dashboard Mini-lastic, because now it can become super compact. The minimum size is also now the same on every operating system, display resolution, ...

Well I got Elastic installed and it appears that text variables don’t work. However in playing around with it I added a speedometer style widget and it looks like it will work just fine. I also have the camera working correctly and I think I see how to do a few other things that I want to do. It seems that Elastic doesn’t start automatically like some of the built-in ones. If there was something explaining how to do that, I missed it. I’m sure there is a way (probably obvious) to do that but I’m still working my way through Dashboard stuff and hope someone can point me to it.

I’ll keep looking but would be delighted if someone an help.

Thanks for the suggestions above. I’m sure I’ll have to refer back to them before I’m done.
